column4: Hi, i have a problem with my ubuntu server dns, i have internal connectivity but not external connectivity, when i ping to www.google.com i get: uknown host www.google.com
What if you change the DNS of the machine you're pinging from?
i get the same
SOunds like a firewall issue.
i have installed webmin and in the net configuration all is good, and i have the firewall disabled
Just curious.... How are you getting here without DNS?
im in other pc
and i connect to the server via ssh
Ok.  so it's just the server that can't resolve.
yes
Can the server ping by IP?
when i ping to an ip i get: network is unreachable
Hmm.
Is the gateway set correctly?
i think the gateway is set correctly, its 192.168.1.1, that is the router address, and i dont understand the 2ยบ question
that should be correct.  How about the subnet mask?
Wow. everything sounds fine.  maybe a router setting denying access? Try changing the IP of the server and see if that fixes it.
i think all about the network configuration its ok because i have internal connectivity, and i can connect from other pcs to the files throw the samba server installed
how do i do that?
Over ssh? Hrm...
yes, and via web, by the webmin. https://192.168.1.36:10000
I suppose you could do it more easily via webmin. you'd just have to reconnect to it at the new IP after confirming the change.
i do not know how to caching the ip
